result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachary R Firehammer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-THC(>200-1000g), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs ad surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge.  To be paid out of up to 25% of prison wages. Any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgmet to be entered.

Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving one half (1/2) Initial Confinement.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full time employment.

No ilegal drugs.
No controlled substances without valid prescription.
No conact with drug community.

Cognitive behavior therapy.
Conditions of Extended supervision to be determined by DOC, but to include those as listed.
Alcohol and drug assessment. Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.  Random urine screens.  No positive results.

supervisions.notes:
Submit a DNA sam;le if not already done.
Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons. Civil rights suspended until reinstated.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Zachary R Firehammer

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Order Concerning Sentence Adjustment, signed and filed. tk 
The petition for sentence adjustment is granted because it is in the public interest and is no based on a change in law or procedure.
Copies mailed to parties.
Response from ADA Crivello received and filed. tk
Notice to District Attorney/District Attorney Response on Petition for Sentence Adjustment signed on 10-12-2015.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to Carolina Stark, Branch 17, for review. jbs
Original Transcript SENTENCING HEARING  (25 pages) commencing JULY 29, 2014 received and filed.

Defendant Zachary R Firehammer in court with attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty.  Laura A. Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PSI addressed; no corrections or additions made.   
  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant. The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 36 
months, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 18 months with credit for 0 days
time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 18 months.
Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:
  
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*Maintain absoute sobriety.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he/she may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, out of up to 25% prison wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 1/2 initial confinement.
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant Zachary R Firehammer in court with attorney Patrick K Cafferty.  Patricia I Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Sentencing hearing rescheduled to 7-29-14, 8:30.

Defendant Zachary R Firehammer in court with attorney Patrick K Cafferty.  Laura A Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: alp    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.   PSI ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.
State's Response To Defendant's Motion To Suppress Evidence received and filed with court.

Defendant Zachary R Firehammer in court with attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty.  Laura A. Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case adjourned for a Motion To Suppress Hearing in Branch 26 on May 13, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Zachary R Firehammer in court with attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty.  Danielle Chojnacki for Laura A. Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 2, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Court ordered no possession or use of NO ILLEGAL DRUGS.   DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 3:00 P.M. ON FEBRUARY 28, 2014. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Zachary R Firehammer in court with attorney Patrick K Cafferty.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 2/27/14 @ 1:30pm
